channel.title: Oli Frost
channel.description: Portfolio of satirist and musician Oli Frost

item.title: I pretend I'm a married woman on Instagram
item.description: Last month I launched Lifefaker

item.title: I put all my personal Facebook data on eBay
item.description: Everyone else's making money off it, so why shouldn't I?

item.title: I made an algorithm that wins advertising awards
item.description: In advertising, nothing is more coveted than a Cannes Grand Prix award.

item.title: I brought the personalisation craze to health warnings
item.description: From Marmite to Nutella, everybody was doing personalisation.

item.title: I founded a startup to help you be more fake online
item.description: Last year I injured both my knees falling off a chair.

item.title: I took on the Vice media empire
item.description: In 2016 some friends and I started an online news channel.

item.title: I launched a crowdfunding platform for bad ideas
item.description: I had wanted to be an inventor since the age of 8.

item.title: I got periods into parliament
item.description: What do you do when your period starts and you're homeless?

item.title: Not all cats want to be on the internet
item.description: It was the cat internet boom of 2014.

item.title: Recorda Boi
item.description: My mission to repopularise the recorder.

item.title: I made an app that hates itself
item.description: It was the app idea to end all app ideas.

item.title: If you like my work, you can buy me a cat
item.description: It's only £17,000

item.title: Climate Strike Posters
item.description: The student climate network had asked me to make some posters.

item.title: Why I'm applying for citizenship in São Tomé
item.description: It was a decision that could change my life forever.

item.title: Am I the father of wearable technology?
item.description: I first noticed the problem ten years ago.

item.title: How I became Russia's nicest hacker
item.description: Fake news has had a lot of bad press.

item.title: I sent all my contacts a dick pic
item.description: And you can too. Discover the world's first Dick Pic Repository.

item.title: I drank a G&T and called the police
item.description: This is the Domestic Rebellion.

item.title: I made Halloween scary again
item.description: Fossil Ghouls is a range of printable, plastic-free masks for ages 3 and up.

item.title: I organise a climate strike for baby penguins
item.description: The strikes were getting coverage on every continent but one.

item.title: I got my girlfriend on Getty Images
item.description: For a lot of guys, getting a girlfriend is all about one thing.

item.title: I can't swim
item.description: The student climate network had asked me to make some posters.

item.title: I impersonate my local council's recycling department
item.description: I'd always felt Lambeth's recycling tips were somewhat lacking.

item.title: The Realistic Earth Emoji
item.description: Currently with the emoji consortium for approval

item.title: I formed a political air-instrument punk band
item.description: Meet Pollution Solution.

item.title: Now That's What I Call Climate Change
item.description: A playlist I made for strikes/protests/end-of-the-world parties.

item.title: I ran a cold wash and saved the world
item.description: 2019 was the year I decided to stop climate change.

item.title: I'm sorting out global climate change
item.description: This is Oli Frost Refrosts The Planet.

item.title: Get £15 when you refer me a friend
item.description: Looking for a friend? There's never been a better time to choose Oli Frost.

item.title: I made my lamp a social media personality
item.description: (What happened next will shock you).

item.title: I tried to bribe Boris Johnson
item.description: COP26 may have failed, but it turns out the tories are for sale.

item.title: I made merch for anti-consumierists
item.description: Ugh! Consumerism

item.title: Don't Cry Santa
item.description: A Christmas classic

item.title: I shook up the soda industry
item.description: Ed and Robyn had been running their soda business for eight years.

item.description: I turned global emissions data into a synthpop ballad

item.title: The Pirate Emergency
item.description: Sung on all good pirate ships

item.title: I turned climate action into an aerobics routine
item.description: For Earth Day and Leg Day

item.title: I gave up cheese for likes
item.description: For every like or comment, I would give up cheese for one hour.

item.title: I vandalised Wikipedia's page for bacon
item.description: It would be my most dangerous internet stunt to date.

item.title: I helped the advertising industry sabotage itself

item.description: Based on their name, and what they had for breakfast
